text: Oregon is still struggling to rebuild after two horrific fire seasons in a row. I’m pressing federal officials to ensure Oregonians have the funding and workforce our state needs to effectively battle these blazes in the upcoming fire season. https://t.co/EwtBH9mAtD

Decisions about what should happen to children and families are far too important to be made by untested algorithms. I’m glad @ORHumanServices is taking the concerns I raised about racial bias seriously and is pausing the use of its AI screening tool. https://t.co/k2aGI2Vrk6

Hood River County residents asked great questions at Friday’s #2022townhall about vote-by-mail, recreation, public lands, the climate crisis, drought, guns & more. Big thanks to the @gorge_news for hosting me in Hood River & @PeoplesTH for moderating. https://t.co/V9In6iZWST

I’m glad to have set up these online sessions to get answers to Eastern Oregon veterans’ questions and to work together on providing them the quality health care they earned here at home with their service for our country.

At this weekend’s first of three scheduled town halls focusing on veterans in Eastern Oregon, rural veterans voiced their justifiable concerns to the VA about its health care delivery delays, service cuts and other changes that move treatment farther away. https://t.co/BqXcC6PGJD

Happy #PrideMonth to everyone celebrating the history, accomplishments and vital contributions of the LGBTQ+ community across Oregon and the country. Today and every day, I remain committed to fighting to make our country a more just and equitable place for all.
